results.title: Hong Kong today
results.brief_description: Hong Kong was faced after the war with problems of over-crowding, unemployment, hardship and disease which to a less courageous and hard-working people might have proved insurmountable. The film surveys the industrial and commercial expansion, the building schemes, the education and health services, the modernisation of transport and the outstanding achievements in land reclamation, which are bringing prosperity to the people of Hong Kong.

results.brief_description: A skit on film making in Hong Kong. A look at the flourishing “string and rubber band” industry which has its comedy moments.

results.title: Hong Kong
results.brief_description: This is a British account of one of its colonies for over one hundred years. It describes the positive influences from Britain on the economy but also documents influences from China due to the large Chinese population, on culture and family. Also recognises China’s desire to regain Hong Kong.

results.title: Honeymation = Mezes-tangos
results.brief_description: Little honey cake figures are animated to lively Hungarian folk tunes. The simple animation techniques could be adapted for primary school use. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Hommage: Francois Couperin
results.brief_description: Animated butterfly ballet suggested by the title of the 17th century French composer’s “Les Papillons”. The film reflects the animator’s admiration of Chinese and Japanese painting as well as of the composer’s music. The animation employs a device similar to stroboscopic or multi- image photography, that creates a smooth and fluid flow of motion, making the delicate choreography beautifully evident.

results.title: Home
results.brief_description: A doco on “home” and “homelessness” - what is a “home” and what does “homelessness” mean to those who live it? The film provides a personal insight and commentary from a cross-section of the homeless community in Melbourne along with those who are lucky enough not to have experienced the social alienation, loneliness and hardships of homelessness. Thought-provoking and experimental in its presentation, Home is beautifully produced and directed by Amanda Sykes, with stunning images by cinematographer Brett Brogan, and supported by an evocative sound design and score from Pip Atherstone-Reid.

results.title: Homage to Verdi
results.brief_description: Follows Sherrill Milnes as he visits Verdi’s birthplace and home in Italy, where Milnes is preparing to perform a Verdi opera.

results.title: Homage a George Bizet
results.brief_description: Biographical account of Georges Bizet’s life supported by and illustrated with excerpts from his compositions. Particularly featured are L’Arlierienne and Carmen. In French language only.

results.title: Holiday: a short tale
results.brief_description: Contemplative short film of one man’s journey of the mind to escape the reality of his daily existence. This is a visually evocative piece, backed by an expressive music soundtrack and the sounds of nature.

results.title: Holiday experiences = Ferienerlebnisse
results.creator_credit: Otto Sacher, D E F A Studio and Progress Film
results.brief_description: In German language. A boy and girl’s adventures in the snow. In a comical train, they travel to a high mountain and the boy skis down it collecting a toboggan en route, sailing along the train’s tracks and finally bumping into the train which concertinas. The girl helps pull the train into shape again and they get in and go home.
